newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Shooting erupts in West Bank, witnesses say.
newsitem.headline: Shooting erupts in West Bank, witnesses say.

text.p: Israeli soldiers and Palestinian police exchanged fire near a Jewish settlement in the West Bank on Friday and six Arabs were wounded, witnesses said.
In another incident three paramilitary Israeli policemen were wounded by shots fired at their base near the self-ruled town of Tulkarm in the West Bank, Israel Radio said.
Witnesses said some 12,000 Palestinians marched on the settlement of Ginat, which was guarded by hundreds of Israeli soldiers.
Palestinian police tried to stop the crowd from advancing but failed. Protesters threw stones at soldiers, who responded with gunfire, wounding six Arabs. Palestinian police then shot back.

In Gaza, 2,000 Palestinian marched from Palestine mosque chanting "Revenge, Revenge", a day after 39 Palestinians and 11 Israelis were killed in the worst violence in the West Bank and Gaza Strip since Israel and the PLO signed peace deals in 1993.
Clashes erupted on Wednesday, a day after Israel opened a tunnel in Jerusalem near Moslem holy places.
